name: Barbarian
shortDesc: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a battle rage
longDesc: Barbarians are defined by their rage. Their rage is a power that fuels a battle frenzy, as well as uncanny reflexes, resilience, and feats of strength. A barbarian can enter a beserker state where rage takes over, giving them superhuman strength and resilience./n/n/To a barbarian, civilization is a sign of weakness. They are uncomfortable when hedged in by walls and crowds and thrive in the wilds of their homeland. The barbarian is a protector of the people and leader in times of war. Courage in the face of danger is what makes a barbarian perfectly suited for adventuring.

startEquip.weapon2: two handaxes OR any simple weapon

types.name: Path of the Beserker
types.desc: This is the path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the beserker’s rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

types.name: Path of the Totem Warrior
types.desc: This path is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage. It is unusual for an individual to have more than one totem spirit, but exceptions do exist.

name: Bard
shortDesc: An inspiring magician whose power echoes the music of creation.
longDesc:
The bard is a master of song, speech, and the magic they contain. The music of bards is an attempt to snatch and harness the echos of the Words of Creation used to shape the multiverse.

The greatest strength of bards is their sheer versatility. They have a wide-ranging knowledge of many subjects and a natural aptitude that lets them do almost anything well. True bards are not common, but it can be hard to spot the difference between an everyday performer and a bard. Discovering the magic hidden in music requires hard study and a measure of natural talent.

 Bards rarely settle in one place for long, and their natural desire to travel makes an adventuring career a natural calling.

startEquip.weapon1: rapier OR longsword OR any simple weapon

types.name: College of Lore
types.desc:
Bards of this college know something about most things, collecting bits of knowledge from sources as diverse as scholarly tomes and peasant tales. They use their gifts to hold audiences spellbound.

The loyalty of these bards lies in the pursuit of beauty and truth. Member's of this college gather in libraries and actual colleges. They also meet at festivals or affairs of state, where they can expose corruption, unravel lies, and poke fun at self-important authority figures.

types.name: College of Valor
types.desc:
Bards of this college are daring poets whose tales keep alive the memory of great heros past. They trave the land to witness great events firsthand and to ensure that the memory of those events doesn’t pass from the world.

These bards gather in mead halls or around great bonfires to sing the deeds of the mighty, both past and present.

name: Cleric
shortDesc: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power.
longDesc:
Clerics are intermediaries between the mortal world and the distant planes of the gods. They strive to embody the handiwork of their deities and are imbued with divine magic. The ability to cast cleric spells relies on devotion and an intuitive sense of a deity's wishes.

 When a cleric takes up an adventuring life, it is usually because his/her god demands it. Pursuing the goals of the gods often involves braving dangers beyond the walls of civilization. Many clerics are also expected to proctect their deity's worshipers.

startEquip.weapon2: light crossbow with 20 bolts OR any simple weapon
misc: scale mail OR leather armor OR chain mail (if proficient)

types.name: Knowledge Domain
types.desc: The gods of knowledge value learning and understanding above all. Some gods teach that knowledge is to be gathered and shared, while others hoard knowledge and keep their secrets to themselves. Followers of these gods study esoteric lore, collect old tomes, delve into secret places of the earth, and learn all they can.

features.name: Additional Spells: Nondetection and Speak with Dead
Additional Spells: Arcane Eye and Confusion
Additional Spells: Legend Lore and Scrying

types.name: Life Domain
types.desc: This domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life. The gods of life promote vitality and health through healing the sick and wounded, caring for those in need, and driving away the forces of death and undeath. Almost any non-evil diety can claim influence over this domain.

features.name: Additional Spells: Bless and Cure Wounds
Additional Spells: Lesser Restoration and Spiritual Weapon
Additional Spells: Beacon of Hope and Revivfy
Additional Spells: Death Ward and Guardian of Faith
Additional Spells: Mass Cure Wounds and Raise Dead

types.name: Light Domain
types.desc: Gods of light promote the ideals of rebirth and renewal, truth, vigilance, and beauty, often using the symbol of the sun. Clerics of a god of light are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their god's discerning vision, charged with chasing away lies and burning away darkness.

features.name: Additional Spells: Burning Hands and Faerie Fire
Additional Spells: Flaming Sphere and Scorching Ray
Additional Spells: Guardian of Faith and Wall of Fire
Additional Spells: Flame Strike and Scrying

types.name: Nature Domain
types.desc: Gods of nature are as varied as the natural world itself. Druids revere nature as a whole and might serve one of these deities, but many of these gods have clerics as well, champions who take a more active role in advancing the interests of a particular nature god.

features.name: Additional Spells: Animal Friendship and Speak with Animals
Additional Spells: Barkskin and Spike Growth
Additional Spells: Plant Growth and Wind Wall
Additional Spells: Dominate Beast and Grasping Vine
Additional Spells: Insect Plague and Tree Stride

types.name: Tempest Domain
types.desc: Gods who influence the tempest domain govern storms, sea, and sky. They include gods of lightening and thunder, gods of earthquakes, some fire gods, and certain gods of violence, physical strength, and courage. Tempest gods send their clerics to inspire fear in the common folk, either to keep those folk on the path of righteousness or to encourage them offer sacrifices of propiation to ward off divine wrath.

features.name: Additional Spells: Fog Cloud and Thunderwave
Additional Spells: Gust of Wind and Shatter
Additional Spells: Call Lightening and Sleet Storm
Additional Spells: Control Water and Ice Storm
Additional Spells: Destructive Wave and Insect Plague

types.name: Trickery Domain
types.desc: Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among gods and mortals. They’re patrons of thieves, scoundrels, gamblers, rebels, and liberators. Their clerics are a disruptive force in the world who prefer subterfuge, pranks, deception, and theft rather than direct confrontation.

features.name: Additional Spells: Charm Person and Disguise Self
Additional Spells: Mirror Image and Pass without Trace
Additional Spells: Blink and Dispel Magic
Additional Spells: Dimension Door and Polymorph
Additional Spells: Dominate Person and Modify Memory

types.name: War Domain
types.desc: The gods of war watch over warriors and reward them for their great deeds. Their clerics excel in battle, inspiring others to fight or offering acts of violence as prayers. Gods of war include champions of honor and chivalry as well as gods of conquest and domination. Other gods of war take a more neutral stance, promoting war in all its manifestations and supporting warriors in any circumstance.

features.name: Additional Spells: Divine Favor and Shield of Faith
Additional Spells: Magic Weapon and Spiritual Weapon
Additional Spells: Crusader’s Mantle and Spirit Guardians
Additional Spells: Freedom of Movement and Stoneskin
Additional Spells: Flame Strike and Hold Monster

name: Druid
shortDesc: A priest of the Old Faith, weilding the powers of nature- moonlight and plant growth, fire and lightening -and adopting animal forms.
longDesc:
Druids are an embodiment of nature’s resilience, cunning, and fury. They claim no mastery over nature, but see themselves as extensions of nature’s indomitable will. Druids revere nature above all, gaining their spells and other magical powers either from the force of nature itself or from a nature deity. The ancient druidic traditions are sometimes called the Old Faith, in contrast to the worship of gods in temples and shrines.

 For druids, nature exists in a precarious balance. The four elements that make up a world (air, earth, fire, and water) must remain in equilibrium. Druids are also concerned with the delicate ecological balance that sustains plant and animal life, and the need for civilized folk to live in harmony with nature. Druids accept that which is cruel in nature and hate the unnatural. Druids are often found guarding sacred sites or watching over regions of unspoiled nature.

startEquip.weapon1: wooden shield OR any simple weapon
startEquip.weapon2: scimitar OR any simple melee weapon

armorProf: *Druids will not wear armor or use shieldsw made of metal*

types.name: Circle of the Land
types.desc: This circle is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition. These druids meet within sacred circles of trees or standing stones to whisper primal secrets in Druidic. As a member of this circle, your magic is influenced by the land where you were initiated into the circle's mysterious rites. The different land types are: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, and underdark.

types.name: Circle of the Moon
types.desc: This circle is made up of fierce guardians of the wilds. Their order gathers under the full moon to share news and trade warnings. They haunt the deepest parts of the wilderness, where they might go for weeks on end before crossing paths with another humanoid creature, let alone another druid. Changeable as the moon, the wild is in the druid’s blood.

name: Fighter
shortDesc: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.
longDesc: Fighters all share an unparalleled mastery with weapons and armor, and a thorough knowledge of the skills of combat. Beyond the basic degree of familiarity, each fighter specializes in a certain style of combat. The combination of broad general ability and extensive specialization makes fighters superior combatants on battlefields and in dungeons alike.

startEquip.weapon1: martial weapon and shield OR two martial weapons
startEquip.weapon2: light crossbow with 20 bolts OR two hand axes
misc: chain mail OR leather armor, long bow, and 20 arrows

types.name: Champion
types.desc: Focuses on development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

types.name: Battle Master
types.desc: Those who model themselves on this archetype employ martial techniques passed down through generations. To a battle master, combat is an academic field. Not every fighter absorbs the lessons of history, theory, and artistry that are reflected in this archetype, but those who do are well-rounded fighters of great skill and knowledge.

types.name: Eldritch Knight
types.desc: Combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with a careful study of magic. Eldritch knights use magical techniques similiar to those practiced by wizards. They focus their study on the abjuration and evocation schools of magic. These knights learn a comparatively small number of spells, commiting them to memory instead of keeping them in a spellbook.

name: Monk
shortDesc: A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.
longDesc:
Monks are united in their ability to magically harness the energy that flows in their bodies. Monks make a careful study of a magical energy that most monastic traditions call ki. This energy is an element that suffuses the multiverse, specifically through living bodies. Monks harness this power within themselves to create magical effects and exceed their bodies’ physical capabilities. Some of their special attacks can hinder the flow of ki in their opponents.

 The majority of monks make frequent visits to nearby towns or villages and exchange their service for food and other goods. As versatile warriors, monks often end up protecting their neighbors from monsters or tyrants. For a monk, becoming an adventurer means leaving a structured, communal lifestyle to become a wanderer. This can be a harsh transition, which monks don’t undertake lightly. Usually, monks care little for material wealth and are driven by a desire to accomplish a greater mission than merely slaying monsters and plundering their treasure.

traits.tools: One type of artisan’s tool OR musical instrument

features.name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon

types.name: Way of the Open Hand
types.desc: Monks of the Way of the Open Hand are the ultimate masters of martial arts combat, whether armed or unarmed. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents, manipulate ki to heal damage to their bodies, and practice advanced meditation that can protect them from harm.

types.name: Way of Shadow
types.desc: Monks of the Way of Shadow follow a tradition that values stealth and subterfuge. These monks might be called ninjas or shadowdancers, and they serve as spies and assassins. Sometimes the members of a ninja monastery are family members that form a clan sworn to secrecy about their arts and missions. Other monasteries are more like thieves’ guilds, hiring out their services to anyone who can pay their fee. Either way, the heads of these monasteries expect unquestioning obedience from their students.

types.name: Way of the Four Elements
types.desc: Monks of the Way of the Four Elements learn to harness the elements. When they focus their ki, they can align themselves with the forces of creation and bend the four elements to their will, using the elements as an extension of their body. Some members if this tradition dedicate themselves to a single element, while others weave the elements together. Many monks from this tradition tattoo their bodies with representations of their ki powers.

name: Paladin
shortDesc: A holy warrior bound to a sacred oath.
longDesc: Paladins are united by their oaths to stand against the forces of evil. A paladin’s oath is a powerful bond and is a source of power that turns a devout warrior into a blessed champion. Different paladins focus on various aspects of the oaths that grant them power to do their sacred work. A paladin’s power comes as much from a commitment to justice itself as it does from a god. Paladins train for years to learn the skills of combat, but their martial skills are secondary to the magical power they weild: power to heal the sick and injured, to smite the wicked and undead, and to protect the innocent and those who join them in the fight for justice.

startEquip.weapon1: martial weapon and sheild OR two martial weapons

types.name: Oath of Devotion
types.desc: Binds a paladin to the loftiest of ideals of justice, virtue, and order. These paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and incorporate images of angelic wings into their coat of arms.

features.name: Oath Spells: Protection from Evil and Good, Sanctuary
Oath Spells: Lesser Restoration, Zone of Truth
Oath Spells: Beacon of Hope, Dispel Magic
Oath Spells: Freedom of Movement, Guardian of Faith

types.name: Oath of the Ancients
types.desc: The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the race of elves and the rituals of the druids. Paladins who swear this oath cast their lot with the side of light in the cosmic struggle against darkness because they love the beautiful and life-giving things of the world, not necessarily because they believe in the principles of honor, courage, and justice. They adorn their armor and clothing with images of growing things to reflect their commitment to preserving life and light in the world.

features.name: Oath Spells: Ensnaring Strike, Speak with Animals
Oath Spells: Plant Growth, Protection from Energy
Oath Spells: Commune with Nature, Tree Stride

types.name: Oath of Vengeance
types.desc: A solemn commitment to punish those who have commited a grievous sin. Paladins arise and swear an Oath of Vengeance to set right that which has gone wrong. To these paladins, their own purity is not as important as delivering justice

features.name: Oath Spells: Hold Person, Misty Step
Oath Spells: Haste, Protection from Energy

name: Ranger
shortDesc: A warrior who uses martial prowess and nature magic to combat threats on the edges of civilization.
longDesc:
Warriors of the wilderness, rangers specialize in hunting monsters that threaten the edge of civilization. They learn to track their quarry like a predator, moving stealthily through the wilds and hiding themselves in brush and rubble. Rangers acquire the ability to cast spells that narness nature’s power, much as a druid does. Their spells and combat abilities emphasize speed, stealth, and the hunt.

In some places, rangers gather in secretive orders or join forces with druidic circles, but many rangers are independent almost to a fault. Their fierce independence makes rangers well suited to adventuring, since they are accustomed to life far from the comforts of a dry bed and hot bath.

types.name: Hunter
types.desc: These rangers accept their place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness. As you walk the hunter’s path, you learn specialized techniques for fighting the threats you face.

types.name: Beast Master
types.desc: These rangers embody a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the wild. United in focus, beast and ranger fight the monsters that threaten civilization and the wilderness alike.

name: Rogue
shortDesc: A scoundrel who uses stealth and trickery to overcome obstacles and enemies.
longDesc:
Rogues rely on skill, stealth, and their foes’ vulnerabilities to get the upper hand in any situation. They have a knack for finding the solution to just about any problem, demonstrating resourcefulness and versatility that is the cornerstone of any successful adventuring party. Rogues devote as much effort to mastering the use of a variety of skills as they do to perfecting their combat abilities, giving them a broad expertise that few other characters can match.

When it comes to combat, rogues prioritize cunning over brute strength. Rogues have an almost supernatural knack for avoiding danger, and a few learn magical tricks to supplement their other abilities. As adventurers, rogues fall on both sides of the law.

startEquip.weapon2: shortbow and quiver of 20 arrows OR shortsword
misc: burglar’s pack OR dungeoneer’s pack OR explorer’s pack

types.name: Thief
types.desc: These rogues hone their skill in the larcenous arts. In addition to improving their agility and stealth, they learn skills usefull for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items they normally couldn’t employ.

types.name: Assassin
types.desc: These rogues focus their training on the grim art of death. Stealth, poison, and disguise help them eliminate their foes with deadly efficiency.

types.name: Arcane Trickster
types.desc: These rogues enhance their fine-honed skills of stealth and agility with magic, learning tricks of enchantment and illusion.

name: Sorcerer
shortDesc: A spellcaster who draws on inherent magic from a gift or bloodline.
longDesc: No one chooses sorcery; the power chooses the sorcerer. Magic is a part of every sorcerer, suffusing body, mind, and spirit with a latent power that waits to be tapped. The appearance of sorcerous power is wildly unpredictable. Most of the time, the talents of sorcery appear as apparent flukes. Some sorcerers can’t name the origin of their power, while others trace it to strange events in their lives. Sorcerers have no use for the spellbooks and ancient tomes of magic lore that wizards rely on, nor do they rely on a patron to grant their spells as warlocks do. By learning to harness and channel their own inborn magic, they can discover new and staggering ways to unleash that power. People with magical power seething in their veins soon discover that the power doesn't like to stay quiet, and that power has a tendency to spill out in unpredictable ways if it isn’t called on.

startEquip.weapon1: light crossbow with 20 bolts OR any simple weapon

types.name: Draconic Bloodline
types.desc: These sorcerers’ innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with their blood or that of their ancestors. Most often, sorcerers with this origin trace their bloodline back to a mighty sorcerer of ancient times who made a bargain with a dragon or who might have even claimed a dragon parent. Any sorcerer could be the first of a new bloodline, as a result of a pact or some other special circumstance.

types.name: Wild Magic
types.desc: These sorcerers’ innate magic comes from the forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation. They might have endured exposure to raw magic, blessed by a fey being, marked by a demon, or their magic could be a fluke of their birth. However it came to be, this magic churns within them, waiting for an outlet.

name: Warlock
shortDesc: A wielder of magic that is derived from a bargain with an extraplanetary entity.
longDesc:
Warlocks are seekers of the knowledge that lies hidden in the fabric of the multiverse. Through pacts made with mysterious beings of supernatural power, warlocks unlock magical effects both subtle and spectacular. Warlocks draw on the ancient knowledge of beings such as fey nobles, demons, devils, hags, and alien entities of the Far Realm and piece together arcane secrets to bolster their own power.

Warlocks are driven by an insatiable need for knowledge and power, which compels them into their pacts and shapes their lives. A warlock is defined by their pact with an otherworldly being. Most often, the arrangement is similiar to that between a master and apprentice. The magic bestowed on a warlock ranges from minor but lasting alterations to the warlock’s being to access to powerful spells. Once a pact is made, a warlock’s thirst for knowledge and power can’t be slaked with mere study and research.

 Warlocks supplement their magic with some facility at hand-to-hand combat.

startEquip.weapon1: light crossbow with 20 bolts OR any simple weapon

types.name: The Archfey
types.desc:
This patron is a lord or lady of the fey, a creatur eof legend who holds secrets that were forgotten before the mortal races were born. This being’s motivations are often inscrutable, and sometimes whimsical, and might involve striving for greater magical power or settling age-old grudges.

 Examples of these beings are: the Prince of Frost, the Queen of Air and Darkness and ruler of the Gloaming Court, Titania of the Summer Court, the Green Lord (Oberon), the Prince of Fools (Hyrsam), and ancient hags.

types.name: The Fiend
types.desc:
This patron is a being from the lower planes of existence, whose aims are evil, even if a warlock strives against those aims. Such beings desire the corruption or destruction of all things, ultimately including the warlock.

 Fiends powerful enough to forge a pact include: demonlords such as Demogorgon, Orcus, Fraz’Urb-luu, and Baphomet; archdevils such as Asmodeus, Dispater, Mephistopheles, and Belial; especially mighty pit fiends and balors; and ultroloths and other lords of the yugoloths.

types.name: The Great Old One
types.desc:
This patron is a mysterious entity whose nature is utterly forweign to the fabric of reality. Its motives are incomprehensible to mortals, and its knowledge so immense and ancient that even the greatest libraries pale in comparison to the vast secrets it holds. The Great Old One might be unaware of a warlock’s existence or entirely indifferent to them, but the secrets a warlock has learned allows them to draw their magic from it.

 Entities of this type include: Ghaunadar, That Which Lurks; Tharizdun, the Chained God; Dendar, the Night Serpent; Zargon, the Returner; Great Cthulhu; and other unfathomable beings.

name: Wizard
shortDesc: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality.
longDesc: Wizards are supreme magic-users, defined and united as a class by the spells they cast. They draw on the subtle weave of magic that permeates the cosmos to cast their spells. Wizards live and die by their spells; everything else is secondary. They learn new spells are they experiment and grow in experience. They can also learn from other wizards, ancient tomes or inscriptions, and ancient creatures that are steeped in magic. The lure of knowledge and power calls even the most unadventerous wizard out of the safety of their libraries and laboratories and into crumbling ruins and lost cities. Most wizards believe that their counterparts in ancient civilizations knew secret magic that has been lost to the ages, and discovering those secrets could unlock the path to a power greater than any magic available in the present age.

types.name: School of Abjuration
types.desc: Emphasizes magic that blocks, banishes, or protects. You understand that ending harmful effects, protecting the weak, and banishing evil influences is a proud and respected vocation.

types.name: School of Conjuration
types.desc: Favors spells that produce objects and creatures out of thin air. As your mastery grows, you learn spells of transportation and can teleport yourself across vast distances.

types.name: School of Divination
types.desc: All seek a clearer understanding of the past, present, and future. As a diviner, you strive to part the veils of space, time, and conciousness so that you can see clearly. You work to master spells of discernment, remote viewing, supernatural knowledge, and foresight.

types.name: School of Enchantment
types.desc: Memebers have honed their ability to magically entrance and beguile other people and monsters.

types.name: School of Evocation
types.desc: Emphasizes magic that creates powerful elemental effects such as bitter cold, searing flame, rolling thunder, crackling lightening, and burning acid.

types.name: School of Illusion
types.desc: Focus of studies on magic that dazzles the senses, befuddles the mind, and tricks even the wisest folk. Your magic is subtle, but the illusions crafted by your keen mind make the impossible seem real.

types.name: School of Necromancy
types.desc: Explores the cosmic forces of life, death, and undeath. As you focus your studies in this tradition, you learn to manipulate the energy that animates all living things. As you progress, you learn to sap the life force from a creature as your magic destroys its body, transforming that vital energy into magical power you can manipulate. Not all necormancers are evil, but the forces they manipulate are considered taboo by many societies.

types.name: School of Transmutation
types.desc: Studies spells that modify energy and matter. To you, the world is not a fixed thing, but eminently mutable, and you delight in being an agent of change. You wield the raw stuff of creation and learn to alter both physical forms and mental qualities.
